messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] wipe boards
messages.msgSnippet: It should be possible to get proprietory board cleaner from stationery/office suppliers, but I ve got stuff off by going over with the same pen and rubbing
messages.messageBody:
It should be possible to get proprietory board cleaner from stationery/office suppliers, but I've got stuff off by going over with the same pen and rubbing while it's wet...  Bit heavy on pen, unfortunately, but if you've nowt else..
 
Tracy
----- Original Message -----
From: D Klement
To: Unschooling-dotcom@onelist.com
Sent: Monday, March 06, 2000 4:14 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] wipe boards

From: D Klement <klement@...>

A. Yates wrote:
>
> From: "A. Yates" <hooperck@...>
>
> Here is a weird question....
> What do you clean one of those magic marker wipe off boards with when
> the marker won't come off.  We used the right kind of marker, but after
> awhile, they don't erase very much.
> ????
> Ann

Nail polish remover may make make take the finish off or pit on those
soft wall calendar wipe off posters. Hard wipe-off boards and soft ones
I've used plain old Windex type window cleaner....the kind with amonia.
Wipe a second time with water to get rid of the smell.

Buzz

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] wipe boards
messages.msgSnippet: We use nail polish remover, but I don t know how safe it is.  It sure works, though. Betsy Wright The Wright Way To Homeschool
messages.messageBody:
We use nail polish remover, but I don't know how safe it is.  It sure works, though.
 
Betsy Wright
 
The Wright Way To Homeschool
http://www.angelfire.com/fl3/homeschoolingwrights
email:  deejay@...

Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] wipe boards

Here is a weird question....
What do you clean one of those magic marker wipe off boards with when
the marker won't come off.  We used the right kind of marker, but after
awhile, they don't erase very much.
????
Ann
